title: Madonna is forced to POSTPONE her Madame X tour as she recovers from a knee injury
text:
Madonna has been forced to postpone her Madame X tour as she's put on bed rest for three days to recover from a recent knee injury.

The pop icon, 61, was expected to perform at New York's BAM Howard Gilman Opera House on Monday evening, but has had to reschedule her gig to Thursday due to her poor condition.

Musician Madonna took to Instagram to admit cancelling her concert hurts her 'more than you can imagine', but has reassured fans she's not a 'quitter' and will be back on stage later in the week.

Brief break: Madonna has been forced to postpone her Madame X tour as she's put on bed rest for three days to recover from a recent knee injury (pictured on Sunday)

An official statement on her website read: 'Unfortunately, Madonna's Madame X concert this evening at BAM Howard Gilman Opera House is postponed.

'Madonna is currently dealing with a knee injury and has been advised rest for the next three days to assist in her recovery.

'Fans are encouraged to hold onto their tickets pending information on rescheduling.

Injured: The pop icon, 61, was expected to perform at NYC's BAM Howard Gilman Opera House on Monday, but has rescheduled her gig to Thursday due to her condition (pictured last month)

'The Madame X concerts this Thursday, October 10th and Saturday, October 12th are expected to proceed as scheduled. We regret the inconvenience to fans. Thank you for understanding.' [sic]

The hard-working artist later insisted she is also a human being 'made of flesh and blood' and is required to rest for full recovery.

Alongside a throwback snap of the singer on stage, the Like A Prayer hitmaker wrote: 'Its Hard for Madame ❌ to admit that she is also a human being made of flesh and blood and she must rest for the next 3 days to insure full recovery for her knee.

Details: An official statement on her website read: 'Unfortunately, Madonna's Madame X concert this evening at BAM Howard Gilman Opera House is postponed'

She'll be back! The musician admitted cancelling her concert hurts her 'more than you can imagine', but has reassured fans she's not a 'quitter' and will be back on stage later in the week

'I am not a quitter. This hurts me more than you can imagine. Its time to take those heels and fishnets off for a few days!. Thank you for your understanding. ♥️. See you very soon !!' [sic]

In a separate video, the 4 Minutes singer's stage team wished the star a speedy recovery as they shared in unison: 'We love you M! Feel better!'

Overwhelmed with emotion, Madonna captioned the clip: '[Love] is the best medicine........................ #ganggang #madamextheater #ongod' [sic].

Support: In a separate video, the 4 Minutes singer's stage team wished the star a speedy recovery as they shared in unison: 'We love you M! Feel better!'

The blonde beauty was previously forced to reschedule a selection of dates on her tour due to the 'highly specialised production elements' of the show.

In a statement, the Vogue singer said she had 'underestimated' the time needed to put on the 'most unique and magical musical experience' for her fans, and confessed her alter-ego Madame X is nothing but a 'perfectionist'.

She explained in August: 'Madame X is a perfectionist and wants to give you the most unique, magical, and musical experience.

Support: The blonde beauty was previously forced to reschedule a selection of dates on her tour due to the 'highly specialised production elements' of the show

Rearrangements: The beauty was previously forced to reschedule a selection of dates on her tour due to the 'highly specialised production elements' of the show (pictured in August)

'She underestimated the amount of time it would take to bring this kind of intimate theatrical experience to you and wants it to be perfect!!! Thank you so much for your understanding.'

Madonna is scheduled to perform in the Big Apple until October 12, before jetting to Chicago until the end of the month.

The media personality will take to the stage in other states of the US - including Las Vegas, Philadelphia and Miami - until December 22, before kicking off the European leg of her tour in Lisbon's Coliseu dos Recreios on January 12.
